summary: Pokemon Card of the Day #1608: Espeon (Dark Explorers)
title: Pokemon Card of the Day #1608: Espeon (Dark Explorers)
body:
We’ve already looked at a few of Eevee’s many evolved forms from this set, none of which had a real chance to keep up. Why would Espeon be any different, you might ask? Well, this time the card just had to sit there on the Bench to do its job instead of using attacks, and while the format wasn’t that great for what it did, there was a particular top deck that had a ton of problems when this was around. Maybe there was a place for a relative of Eevee after all.

90 HP was not very impressive. While by no means uncommon on a Stage 1, there were just so many strong attackers that hit 90 or higher that Espeon could easily be dragged out for an easy KO. The Psychic Weakness made life even easier for Mewtwo EX, which was never a good thing. At least it could retreat for a single Energy. That meant that decks relying on weaker attacks couldn’t just drag Espeon up front to stall.

Espeon had one thing going for it. That was the Ability, Solar Revelation, that prevented all effects of your opponent’s attacks, other than damage, done to any of your Pokemon with any Energy attached to it. It is notable that, if the effect was on you and not the Pokemon, it didn’t work. You were still locked by Seismitoad EX and the rarer Zebstrika and Dragonite, for example. What this did do was make a total mess out of those DuskCelgor decks that used Accelgor to set Special Conditions and Gothitelle for locking with Dusknoir as damage manipulation. The whole deck relied on that Paralysis and Poison and if a Pokemon with Energy was the target that just didn’t work. Since that deck was very good, Espeon had some tech potential.

Psy Report did 60 damage for a Psychic and 2 Colorless Energy while letting you see your opponent’s hand. That information was good, to be fair. Not worth the somewhat low damage when you really wanted something else to attack, though.

Espeon was pretty rare on the competitive scene, but it had a small role. If you wanted to get that third type of Eevee early in the game in a Flareon deck, Espeon could be worth considering. Being able to mess up Accelgor was pretty cool. It did have competition for that #3 slot with Plasma Freeze Umbreon and its HP boost, however, and most Flareon decks didn’t even go for the third Eevee since Flareon and Leafeon could hold their own rather well when given some unrelated support. Even with that being said, at least it had some role. It wasn’t a bad option if you wanted that specific sort of protection.

summary: Pokemon Detective Pikachu: Better Than Expected
title: Pokemon Detective Pikachu: Better Than Expected
body:
There’s been a long and uneasy relationship between video games and movies. Whether it’s a major film getting a video game spin-off, or a theatrical adaptation of a famous game franchise, the overall outcome has always been… underwhelming. And with tensions high from the live action Sonic trailer, the idea of a live action Pokémon movie sounds unnerving in concept.

So when I walked into the dimly lit theater to catch the 3:20 showing of Pokémon Detective Pikachu, I was nervous. I’ve been a fan of Pokémon since the release of Pokémon Red and Blue on the original Game Boy. I was steeling myself for a childish and awkward movie with ugly creatures flailing about on screen.

It was a huge sigh of relief to leave the theater hoping they’d make another one.

Read More

blog.name: pokemon-plush-rescue
blog.title: Pokemon Plushie Rescue
blog.description: Over the years I've rescued a lot of Pokemon plushies from thrift stores and yard sales, and I put this blog together to catalog my different Pokemon rescues, as well as the other Pokemon plushies that have come into my life that never cease to make me smile. With the success of Dr. Sword's recovery post on my main blog, I'd figure this would also be an interesting place to have

summary: This is Charcoal the Umbreon! I got him as an Easter present from my mom a couple years back, and his tag claims he’s a Pokemon...
caption: This is Charcoal the Umbreon! I got him as an Easter present from my mom a couple years back, and his tag claims he’s a Pokemon Center plush. My mom says she ordered him off Wish, which is where she does a lot of minor gift shopping. Charcoal is just the first of many that were gifts from my mom’s Wish shopping. He had a slight popped seam, and one of his rings was coming loose on one of his legs when I got him, so he’s had a minor amount of work done, but that just gave us a deeper bond between trainer and Pokemon. He has very soft fur, and the ribbon around his neck came off of a Harry Potter wand that came in a fancy box that I figured would look great on this guy. Charcoal is a wonderful addition to my Pokefamily, specifically the Eeveelution branch.

summary: Super excited to reveal my first jump into earrings with these Cubone Skull studs!! These are particularly special to me, as...
caption:
Super excited to reveal my first jump into earrings with these Cubone Skull studs!! These are particularly special to me, as earrings are the the very first things I used to make back in the day with found objects around the house, so to be able to make some real earrings has been super fun! They will be dropping alongside the new biker club members this Friday April 19 @ 6PM PST!

Shop:
Pewtercitytrading.com
Pewtercitytradingco.etsy.com
From Instagram
